alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 11:41AM EDT until April 21 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Menominee, Marinette and Dickinson Counties. Menominee River near Niagara affecting Menominee, Marinette, Dickinson and Florence Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Iron, Dickinson and Florence Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Pike River near Amberg affecting Marinette County. Menominee River near Menominee River at White Rapids Dam affecting Menominee and Marinette Counties. Menominee River near Menominee River Below Kingsford Dam affecting Marinette, Dickinson and Florence Counties. Menominee River below Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain affecting Menominee, Marinette, Dickinson and Florence Counties. Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Iron, Dickinson, Florence and Forest Counties. Peshtigo River near Porterfield affecting Marinette County. Peshtigo River below Caldron Falls Dam affecting Marinette County. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Pembine, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Florence. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, flood waters reach a few homes and cottages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
